meanings.definition: To play a series of light, short sounds on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys tootling on her flute in the evenings.
meanings.sent2: The musician was tootling a cheerful tune on his trumpet.
meanings.sent3: The bird seemed to be tootling a melody on its tiny flute-like beak.
meanings.sent4: The wind tootled through the trees like a gentle flute player.
meanings.sent5: The sound of tootling echoed through the room, filling it with joy.

meanings.definition: To move or go in a leisurely manner.
meanings.sent1: The cat was tootling around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent2: We spent the afternoon tootling along the riverbank, enjoying the scenery.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was tootling at its own pace, not bothered by the hustle around.
meanings.sent4: The clouds tootled across the sky, drifting lazily in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The old car tootled down the country road, taking its time to reach the destination.

meanings.definition: A series of light, short sounds made on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The tootling of the flute added a magical touch to the performance.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with the sweet tootling of the piccolo.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected tootling of the kazoo made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The tootling of the recorder reminded her of childhood music lessons.
meanings.sent5: The tootling of the clarinet created a soothing atmosphere in the park.
